review_title: All of my friends work here!
pros: Caring administration. Great coworkers. Always evolving operations that help improve workflow.
cons: Pay for dental assistants can be better at private offices so there is more turnover than is ideal.

review_title: Does Not Honor their Mission statement and Values
pros: There is not one 'Pro' at this company
cons: No Communication, so you can't do your job efficiently and correctly. No training. Gossip and extremely unprofessional Sr. leaders who lack much needed knowledge of managing an organization. Discrimination and you feel like you're walking on egg shells all the time. very heartless management with one-sided views who aren't open to others thoughts or suggestions. No empowerment; no room for growth; low team morale across the board, whether it's in the clinics or their corporate headquarters. Worse place I've worked in my whole life. Horrible work environment and thick air 24/7. If you want to feel undervalued and not appreciated for your dedication and hard work, :(, work here.

review_title: Awful place to work, low salary, high salaries for management team, but low pay for other staff
pros: The mission of the organization is great
cons: Management needs education and training, Supervisors are allowed to hire their family members.

pros: Poor management, short staffed, difficult
cons: Do not work here Poor management, short staffed, difficult

review_title: Good job but company is growing too fast
pros: Good pay and benefits for some jobs, not for all. They offer travel expenses too. It’s a great temporary job or for someone just out of school
cons: The company is growing quickly, which is great because the community needs it. However, they need to take care of problems before adding in more clinics. You are more of a faceless number here unless you are part of the admin team.

pros: PTO/sick time/ and front desk.
cons:
You barely get a lunch or 10 minute break. Knowthe law

Employees must be allowed a paid rest period, free from duties, of at least 10 minutes for every 4 hours worked. Additionally:
Employees cannot be required to work more than 3 hours without a rest break.
Breaks must be scheduled as close to the midpoint of a work period as possible.
Employers can require workers to stay on the job site during a rest break.
Rest breaks taken are considered “hours worked” when calculating paid sick leave and overtime.
In some jobs, “mini” rest breaks can be taken instead of a scheduled rest break. These “mini” rest breaks must total at least 10 minutes over a 4-hour period.

pros: PCHS has taken a never before seen Pandemic and handled it with such professionalism and proficiency. The vaccine clinics are so efficient and our community's are so grateful. So proud to work for PCHS
cons: Department growth not expanding with Company growth.

pros: Supportive mentorship and great PTO earning
cons: Low pay for the amount of work and emotional stress that you take on. Huge pay gap between upper management and lower staff. No advancement opportunity.

pros: Great place to see a variety of patients and conditions. Supportive learning environment
cons: Very busy work environment. Patient appointments are usually 15 minutes.

pros: Family friendly, good senior leadership
cons: Chronically Short staffed high turn over rate

pros: The community is very friendly and welcoming.
cons: I haven't had negative experiences.

pros:
It’s not just about finding the right job; it’s about finding the right company.
People come to work because they want to be part of something big, something rewarding. They want to work for a company that makes a difference in peoples’ lives, a company that is doing great things in the world- providing the best health care possible & valuing it’s employees and at PCHS we are all that & more. 
PCHS is a home away from home for its employees and the “back bone” for providing quality, affordable & readily accessible health care in our communities. I value the company’s willingness to accept employee’s ideas for future advancement and to empower staff with academic growth.
The company’s motto- WE ACCEPT ALL PATIENTS, WE DO NOT TURN AWAY ANYONE- speaks for itself- it gives the highest respect to our patients. In the 2 years that I have had the privilege of working for PCHS, the company has grown exponentially -not only Medical, but Dental, Behavioral Health Services, Chemical Dependency & Pharmacy Services, and has been made readily available to our community. 
In Summary PCHS uses a synergistic approach in providing care to our patients.
cons: WE need more expansion of PCHS to provide service to other areas of Western WA in order to better service our region and at risk population

pros: I am an ARNP at PCHS and I have truly enjoyed working here. I love the clientele and my schedule options. Right now I work 4 days a week, 10 hour shifts, but have the option to go to 5 days a week, 8 hour days. Right now I like having the extra day off, but like that I can change to a different schedule if I need to. I haven't had an issue with getting PTO for vacations and I only have to take call once every couple months. Overall I am very satisfied with my employment here and do not plan on leaving anytime soon.
cons: The clientele may be a con to some. It is mostly Medicaid patients and at times can be difficult. There is a high need for mental health in the area and not enough resources, so providers end up doing a lot of mental health management that would typically be done elsewhere (this may be a con to some, but I personally don't mind).

review_title: Poor Treatment of PAs and NPs
pros: The only good part about working for PCHS was helping the patients who needed it most and the people in my clinic.  They were good people to work with.
cons: Administration treats PAs and NPs VERY poorly as if they are second class citizens compared to MDs.  The NPs and PAs are the only providers who take patient call and run the Extended Hours clinic - MDs are not required to do this.  MDs are allowed control over their schedules and can dictate which patients require more time but NPs and PAs are not allowed this courtesy.  Each time providers try to recommend changes that can help with patient care the first answer from administration is no.  This is a very frustrating place to work and you will be treated very poorly and as if you are completely expendable.

review_title: A Great Place to learn and Grow
pros:
Started there as a Student and worked there for a lot years 
Became a Front Desk/Call center , MA and eventually transitioned as a Supervisor 
All the knowledge that i gained from them is the reason where I am at today in life.
Will always be gratefull for that Oppurtunity and believing in me.

Having that chance to be part of something that Helps the Community and that feeling of being able to make a difference in peoples lives.

Countless Amazing people that i worked with that over the years became Family to me Those Realtionships that forever will be treasured.
cons: Not having a lot of Specialties to be able to serve Patients even further

pros: The staff the work the front lines and behind the scenes are here for the right reason. They care about the patient population we serve and want to do a good job. Staff gets along well. Benefits are ok. You start accruing time and benefits from your first day. YMCA membership is a nice bonus.
cons: Not crazy about the upper management. Have never met the CEO. Some of these people have never left their office to see what is going on in the clinics. Micromanagement at its worst.  Pay is terrible!

pros: This clinic system is well organized.  I like having policies and procedures and knowing what is expected.  Feels really fair!  Very happy with compensation and benefits.  Easy to get answers to questions; training met my needs.  Pharmacy support is incredible.
cons: Patients have difficulty calling to schedule, questions, etc.  The tech savvy use the portal, which is excellent.  If I want to call my office, there is no back line, so I text my MA.

pros: Great providers, great coworkers, having mental health and dental care integrated into the clinics is helpful and a lot of complex patient cases to learn from
cons: Terrible management, I had a department head scream at me so loudly that patients complained, I was straight up lied to about my pay rate, and they also liked to use fear as a tactic. Everything is tracked as a way to blame someone when a mistake is made. I was also micromanaged a lot by my direct supervisor.

review_title: Great place to work, love going to my job!!
pros: There are many opportunities to meet all the executives and senior leaders, there are also staff events for everyone to get to know one another. I love that regardless of title everyone is treated equally
cons: None, anything you might have questions about are always answered as long as its communicated.

pros: Great people to work with, everyone is very caring and supporting in both professional and personal issues.
cons: Not sure from one day to the next what direction management wants to go.  Constantly changing the finish line, not sure where you stand.

review_title: PCHS proves integrated healthcare with all supports in place necessary to provide best practice services to all patients
job_title: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner in Port Orchard, WA
pros: Mission not just lip service, they walk the talk
cons: Pay is average for providers

pros:
Manage a diverse group of staff members. 
Ability to serve patients using our many resources, programs and options at each of our locations.
Competitive benefits
Clean and safe work environments
cons: Supervising two medical offices can be challenging at times.

pros: PCHS practices what it preaches - to help the community.  It's very rewarding to know that what you do directly helps improves the lives of others.
cons: Sometimes you want to do more to help.

pros: Helping our community and ensuring everyone has a place to get affordable healthcare
cons: The benefits could be better.

job_title: Clinical Coordinator in Port Orchard, WA
pros:
Wonderful team to work with
Strong Administration support
Great Hours.
cons: There is nothing bad to say about PCHS

pros: Great mission, doing vital work in their communities
cons: so much need, so little time

pros: Great people, great pay and great benefits
cons: Schedule is not consistent
